channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Kamala Harris is live from New York on "Saturday Night Live"
item.description: Vice President Harris is the latest in a long line of politicians to appear on the sketch comedy show over its 50 seasons. In 2015, Donald Trump delivered the show's cold open monologue.
item.content:encoded:
Vice President Harris is the latest in a long line of politicians to appear on the sketch comedy show over its 50 seasons. In 2015, Donald Trump delivered the show's cold open monologue.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: Asma Khalid

item.title: Trump detours to blue state Virginia as he and Harris crisscross swing states
item.description: Former President Donald Trump leaned into the culture wars in his Salem, Va., rally after he and Vice President Harris both made stops in the Charlotte, N.C., area earlier in the day.
item.content:encoded:
Former President Donald Trump leaned into the culture wars in his Salem, Va., rally after he and Vice President Harris both made stops in the Charlotte, N.C., area earlier in the day.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: Eric McDaniel

item.title: Citing the pandemic, TGI Fridays files for bankruptcy
item.description: The casual dining chain, which saw dozens of its U.S. restaurants close this year, said its financial woes stem from the coronavirus pandemic.
item.content:encoded:
The casual dining chain, which saw dozens of its U.S. restaurants close this year, said its financial woes stem from the coronavirus pandemic.

(Image credit: Eduardo Munoz Alvarez)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: Satellite images show the devastation from Spain's deadly floods
item.description: The images show a devastating transformation of eastern Spain, where at least 205 people have been killed by flash floods.
item.content:encoded:
The images show a devastating transformation of eastern Spain, where at least 205 people have been killed by flash floods.

(Image credit: Lauren Dauphin)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: U.K. Conservatives pick Kemi Badenoch as their party's new leader
item.description: The party elected Kemi Badenoch as its new leader as it tries to rebound from a crushing defeat that ended 14 years in power. She is the first Black woman to lead a major British political party.
item.content:encoded:
The party elected Kemi Badenoch as its new leader as it tries to rebound from a crushing defeat that ended 14 years in power. She is the first Black woman to lead a major British political party.

(Image credit: Alberto Pezzali)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Chef Edward Lee reflects on 'Culinary Class Wars', identity and his next chapter
item.description: After three decades in Southern cuisine, Lee's next culinary chapter explores Korean American cooking, moving beyond traditional recipes and fusion concepts.
item.content:encoded:
After three decades in Southern cuisine, Lee's next culinary chapter explores Korean American cooking, moving beyond traditional recipes and fusion concepts.

(Image credit: Shuran Huang)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Iran's supreme leader threatens Israel, U.S. with 'crushing response' to Israeli attack
item.description: Iran's supreme leader threatened Israel and the U.S. with “a crushing response” over attacks on Iran and its allies. The Pentagon said Friday that more U.S. forces would be coming to the region.
item.content:encoded:
Iran's supreme leader threatened Israel and the U.S. with “a crushing response” over attacks on Iran and its allies. The Pentagon said Friday that more U.S. forces would be coming to the region.

(Image credit: Office of the Iranian Supreme Leader)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: An influencer thought someone dropping off ballots was ‘suspect.’ It was the postman
item.description: Even before Election Day, unsubstantiated rumors about voter fraud are beginning to focus on specific public servants and voters, leading to harassment and threats.
item.content:encoded:
Even before Election Day, unsubstantiated rumors about voter fraud are beginning to focus on specific public servants and voters, leading to harassment and threats.

(Image credit: Ed Jones)
item.dc:creator: Lisa Hagen

item.title: Sikhs march across California urging protections against threats from India on U.S. soil
item.description: Sikh activists marched 350 miles across California in October to mark the 40th anniversary of a massacre and call for protections from what they say is a growing threat from the Indian government.
item.content:encoded:
Sikh activists marched 350 miles across California in October to mark the 40th anniversary of a massacre and call for protections from what they say is a growing threat from the Indian government.

(Image credit: Mike Kai Chen for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Sandhya Dirks

item.title: At a historic cemetery in the South, a Dia de los Muertos festival takes root
item.description: At a historic Southern cemetery, a Mexican tradition has found a home.
item.content:encoded:
At a historic Southern cemetery, a Mexican tradition has found a home.

(Image credit: Aaron Sanchez-Guerra)
item.dc:creator: Aaron Sanchez-Guerra
